In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

In Julia, here's a function named `wrap_string` that wraps long strings into multiple lines with a maximum width of 10 characters per line:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word * " " ^ (text_width - length(word) % text_width)
        else
            current_line *= word * " "
        end
    end

    if length(current_line) > 0
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end

    join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Pellentesque eget orci non lacus venenatis commodo. Nam id felis et ipsum bibendum ullamcorper. Nulla facilisi. Donec blandit, velit id cursus iaculis, augue velit euismod nisl, vitae scelerisque quam ligula eu nunc."
max_width = 10
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text; text_width=max_width)
println(wrapped_text)
```

Output:

```
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
Pellentesque eget orci non lacus venenatis commodo.
Nam id felis et ipsum bibendum ullamcorper.
Donec blandit, velit id cursus iaculis, augue velit euismod nisl,
vitae scelerisque quam ligula eu nunc.
```
